# Introduction

In this document, I'll load the earthquake data from an Excel file.

## Load Libraries


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

:::


## Import the Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Read the Excel file
# Make sure your Excel file is in data/raw/ folder
earthquake_raw <- read_excel("data/raw/earthquake_data.xlsx")

# Convert to data frame
earthquake_raw <- as.data.frame(earthquake_raw)

# Check what we got
cat("Rows:", nrow(earthquake_raw), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 157015 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Columns:", ncol(earthquake_raw), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Columns: 20 
```


:::
:::


## Assign Column Names


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# If your Excel has 20 columns, use these names:
if (ncol(earthquake_raw) == 20) {
  colnames(earthquake_raw) <- c(
    "Year", "Month", "Day", "Hour", "Minute", "Second",
    "Magnitude", "Empty1", 
    "Epicenter_Lat", "Epicenter_Lon",
    "Empty2", "Empty3", 
    "Distance_km", "Station_Lat", "Station_Lon", 
    "Intensity", "State", "Location", "Quality", "Country"
  )
} else {
  # If different number of columns, just use V1, V2, etc.
  colnames(earthquake_raw) <- paste0("V", 1:ncol(earthquake_raw))
  cat("Warning: Expected 20 columns, got", ncol(earthquake_raw), "\n")
}
```
:::


## Quick Look at the Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Show first few rows
head(earthquake_raw, 5) %>% kable()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}

# Basic summary of numeric columns
summary(earthquake_raw %>% select(where(is.numeric)))

## Save the Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Create folder if needed
dir.create("../data/processed", showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)

# Save for next steps
saveRDS(earthquake_raw, "../data/processed/earthquake_raw.rds")
cat("✓ Data saved to data/processed/earthquake_raw.rds\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
✓ Data saved to data/processed/earthquake_raw.rds
```


:::
:::
